intro: Tarenna cinnamomea, commonly known as the cinnamon tree, is a small evergreen shrub or tree native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its aromatic, cinnamon-scented leaves and small, white flowers. The plant produces small, round berries that are typically red when mature. Its leaves are often used in traditional medicine for their aromatic and medicinal properties. Tarenna cinnamomea thrives in tropical climates and is adapted to grow in well-drained, acidic soils.
